alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:15AM MDT until June 26 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Riverton...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding downstream along left bank near Black Bridge begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM MDT Saturday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will remain steady around 8.0 feet through Monday morning, then drop below action or bankfull stage for the rest of the week. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
